intro: Wikstroemia monticola, commonly known as the mountain wikstroemia, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of Hawaii. It belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited range and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
